page.title: 15FARMING AROUND SOUTHEND
page.content: Farming is based upon Grade A farmland of clay loams and brickearth which grow any crop by definition.The influence of Southend and London is small in our case study of{Sutton Hall {Fm}which sells only a few tons of potatoes locally.Cereal crops of Barley and wheat are rotated every 4th and 5th yr out of 8 with Rape and Pot. and now peas. Cereals are marketed thro SHRIM FMS CO-OP, yield 3 tons per acre,Rape 1.25 tons,Pots 12 tons,Peas a new crop this yr.Pots require irrigation and land is chalked every 5yrs.Farm has 14 tractors,2 combines, 2 drills,1 sprayer +other implements. Turnover Â£770,000 P.A.Labour 9 full time and casual staff for potatoes. {Farm Plan(Acres)1985}:Feed wheat 351,Mill wheat 309,Peas 58,Potatoes 140,Rape 200,Grass 18,Trees 18.TOTAL 1,200.The farmer is Mr Charles Tabor.
